												Okay, first of all, I know I got like 0 hours of this on Steam as I'm typing this, I'm literally still downloading this, but hear me out. Please.I've been playing this since it came out 4 years ago; Been on Korean, Chinese and South East Asian servers. I've played through all available classes and most 3rd jobs (Inquisitor, Raven, AbyssWalker, Obscuria, Saleana[Pyromancer?], Soul Eater, etc.) Got 2 characters on level 80, went back to SEA to look after my guild, went to EU to help my brother... Seen this also available on Steam last week and I just HAD to download this (again) to have it on Steam to be able to type out a review to warn people about what's to come. If it was 2012 I'd have given this a thumbs up, licked many ugly feet for it, but sadly this time has long passed.This game was A TON OF FUN.I loved this game.I skipped classes for it.It has the best and most fluid action combat ever.I was literally addicted.There is/was no other action MMORPG that feels/felt like it gameplay-wise. (But I think TianYu/Revelation Online has a similar feel from what I've seen, looking forward to it going OBT)BUT... 70 cap with the new classes, cash item events, constant reminders of the cash shop and these "revamps that should have helped balance" ruined it.!!! Note that what is currently happening in other servers doesn't have to happen in DNEU, community-wise, but it very well could !!!Why?1. Class DiscriminationThere's no room for "low DPS" and "useless" classes from what I've seen in other servers. Class discrimination is everywhere. Kiss your favorite class good-bye if it's discriminated. Class discrimination is one of the worst things to happen in DN, and it's not just the fault of the community, it's also the fault of how Nests and Raids at cap 70+ are made. In order to make it easier they gave classes buffs that weren't meant to have it and thus contributing to the class discrimination. Who needs suppport when you can KOS with a full "useful DPSers" party, right?You only see this kind of setup in almost any nest/raid party:- LightFury/Physician combo*- Ice stacker (Glaciana, Adept)- Main DPSers with "useful KOS buffs" (Assassins, assassins everywhere, or, occasionally, Artilleries and Acrobats, rarely mecha lolis)- If they feel like it, a Saint, but the LF/Physician* combo took that spot even if people argue that the Saint can't be replaced."Wait, where's the tank?" you may ask. Useless. Not needed. They revamped the Guardian, did it help? Nope.Guardian is you main? Good luck, buddy, good luck. Unless you can throw some €€€s (Or farm for ETERNITY) and get all rare grade bling bling and +12~+15 gear and max out FD%, go kiss your favorite character good-bye. I'm not even kidding.Kali? What is a Kali? Do we need that? Nope, not anymore thanks to Lancea and our lovely Raven/Ripper.The once awesome sorceress with the lazers and boom boom is now a boo boo alongside the poor Saleana/Pyromancer since the Majesty/Obscuria boost.Snipers and Tempests are already gathering dust.2. The stat that should have never existedFinal Damage. Remember when everyone told you to max out critical? Good-bye to that too, FD all the way, baby! How do you get it? 3rd stats on heraldries and accessories sets. How do you manage to get that? With luck. A LOT of luck. Those 3rd stat FD heraldry-babies sell for 300~900k gold at DNSEA... Have no idea how much they will sell for in DNEU but I'm PRETTY SURE it's not something you could afford by just farming 4 weeks without selling at least some AC items.*Remember Physicians? Guess why people like them again. No, really, try and guess! ...Tired already? Okay, okay.. 50% FD buff and a Speed buff with Injector EX! How does that sound? Neat! But wait, a healer AND someone to buff FD? Combined with a LightFury that heals and increases damage??? Go dig your graves, Saints. Inquisitors might still have a chance thanks to the boost."Oh, you are gonna start the P2W bullcrap now, aren't you?" Yeeeep. Well, not quite... Maybe... Ehh, yeah, okay, you got me.3. Give me your money!If you compare a character/class that doesn't have any AC items on to a character/class with a full rare (the blue) grade costume set with rare grade accessories, wings and tail, you will suddenly see a difference that you first think might not do much, but you're mistaken. A massive speed boost, rare grade costume set bonuses and the stats the costume gives itself  (Which, I may have to add, might cost you over € 100 to get a full set of, even more if you're just damn unlucky) PLUS the set bonus of the rare grade accessories that assure you a nice +1k~2k Attack Power even if you don't notice it at first. Believe me, I know, I wasted € +200 for that game already.Put these 2 characters in a PVP match; Comp not turned on, no armor. Just costumes. You don't even need to be smart to know who has the upper hand (regardless of who wins) Enchanting: Everyone knows that making weapons unbreakable thanks to the magic of cash items is a very bad thing to have in ANY MMO.Potions. NPC potions are useless, as soon as you hit level 10 you don't even think about them anymore. Cash potions, though? That's a nice 30% HP regen with a very little cooldown you got there! Yeah Yeah, I know I know, farming and cooking! But guess what? want more soil to plant on? Buy a ticket! Need your crops to grow faster? Buy some lovely drugs for your plants! Want to fish better and not waste 4 hours trying to get what you want? Buy a better fishing rod!Premium/Extra Heraldry/Talisman slots. Well why yes let's give the whale more options to pump some more stats into them! "But you can only equip one Agi/Str/Int/Vit Heraldry/Talisman you stupid noob!" Oh, I see... You're new to 3rd stats, right?Pet skills! Pet stats! Wooooooo~!4. Enemies, Nests and DifficultyAs mentioned before, at level 70 cap, things go from "Well that's a bit hard" to "I'VE BEEN HITTING THIS GUY FOR AN HOUR AND HE'S NOT DEAD YET, HOW!?".Nest bosses are ridiculously hard-hitting, have a ton of HP and basically level 70/80 Nests take hours unless you have your OP buffers and DPSers with full FD and +10~+15 gear around.Even normal dungeons are ridiculously hard on Master/Abyss mode at level 60+. When you just turned 60 and go to the new dungeons I wouldn't be surprised you die your first time because, wow, dungeons literally got a lot harder.This is one of the main reasons why this game went very downhill alongside point 1 and 3.It's a shame what this game has become. If it had better graphics it might have survived better, despite it's shortcoming and unfairness... But as soon as B&S and Black Dessert come to the west... DN is nothing special anymore.

												Introduction:First off, I love this game. It is great in so many aspects - yet I can just not recommend it. The thing is, while it was the love-child of someone once, it sure isn't anymore. And, to make matters worse, this "someone" was Korean, which puts oceans and continents between the version you will be playing and the version they are developing for. What is good about the game:The first thing you will find to draw you in will be, without question, the combat. It is fun, it is intuitive, and the learning curve is pleasant. The graphics, while dated, aren't bad for this kind of game. The colorful scenery and interesting level design where a big plus for me. That said, a lot of work went into many of the levels, usually making them feel unique but, at times, a little hard to navigate. The story, as unlikely as it sounds, is good. It's not just "good", it is, by all accounts, great. (For a MMO, that is.)The "grind" is not much of a grind the first time around. If you take your time, not rushing endgame (which you really shouldn't), then you're in for a great time and advance at a good pace. Getting to 80 was everything good in the game.What's so horribly bad that I wouldn't recommend it:Everything at the endgame is a cluster****. I mean it. You can advance almost entirely alone through the game (if you skip out on Nests you can get to lvl 80 without having talked to any other player) - but the moment you hit 80 you WILL need someone to do almost everything. "Sure," you say, "this is a massively multiplayer online game after all", rolling your eyes at me. Well, you are somewhat right, but oh so wrong. You see, playing with others is implied in "multiplayer", yes, but to that end "other people" would be necessary. The game might not be dieing, but there are without question games with more players. Which would be probably every game with more than about 200 players. I am not even exaggerating: There is one mode, "Hero's Battlefield", that you can do at max level. At the end of the week you get a mail with how you ranked for that time period - and I constantly manage to get in the 11-100 bracket. While I am a natural, without question, I am reluctant to believe my crappy gear and inexperience would normally suffice to be this good at something I did for my first and second time. Conclusion: There simply are no players.That leads to the next problem: The players that usually are there, are hardcore, and, usually, a*****es. Sometimes I would even go as far as saying hardcore a*****es. The community consists almost entirely of people that played since they know how to turn on a PC. Which in many cases is only about a few years back. Yet, this game is all they know - you on the other hand, have no Idea of how difficult the endgame content is, of what to do and how to not instantly die because of your crappy gear and / or inexperience. That is, IF you actually manage to get into a group - after all, they want to clear that dungeon quickly and without incidents, so why would they take a under geared noob like meyou with them in the first place? The answer is there is no reason they would and so they won't, so you'll be left to farming gold, so you can buy gear to at least not look like an idiot. Also, the majority is not English native. Sometimes you may even encounter people who don't speak English at all. Now if we ignore the problems with the community and the impossibility of learning what to do in the endgame without help, there is still plenty wrong with this game.You see, the chat, for instance, is ubiquitous. It can't be turned off and it persists through cut-scenes, looking ugly and all. Why is that? Because there is no world chat. Instead, there are so called "blue birds" (twitter someone?) that allow you to send global messages. "Global" being literal: Everyone, everywhere will, without fail, receive that message. However, these birds come at a price. Namely, a real money, hard cash price. You can't get them normally, and a stack of them has to be bought with AC, the fancy "I paid for this" currency. Now you might wonder what I mean with "a stack": You don't buy one blue bird that allows you to use this chat option, because this is not a chat option. Every time you want to send such a message you have to consume 1 unit of blue birds. the best offer, 10 BBs, is a little under 5 bucks. So, OK, maybe that all is not enough to deter you. But maybe this will: Remember how I said "this 'someone' was Korean, which puts oceans and continents between the version you will be playing and the version they are developing for"? There are several things important about this one. First, the cancerous translation. It is not just bad, it is the worst I have seen. Ever. Imagine Google translate for whole sentences, only slightly better. And they literally don't give a damn f***. They have been asked about it, but they won't even let players help that would work for free. There have been accounts of people who screenshotet mistakes and corrected them, only for eyedentity to completely ignore them. That, however, brings us to another topic. If you encounter one of the (various) bugs in the game, or, heaven forbid, spent money on an event and something goes wrong (spoiler: Something always goes wrong) your natural response will be to contact support. Thing is, there is no support for steam users. there is no ingame ticket system and the ticket system on the internet site needs you to log into you account - which doesn't work for steam users. But don't worry, you're not missing out on any stellar service here. If you actually care enough to make a normal account, describe you issue, maybe even have a screenshot or video, then you only have to wait 3 to 4 weeks for a response from their incompetent monkeys of a support team. This may sound rude, but these people, whose job it is being nice and helpful, are usually no help and as far from nice as any support I have ever seen. I'd even argue to say that they actually go out of their way to tell you to go screw yourself, regardless of you being a paying costumer.If that prospect doesn't scare you, be my guest and go ahead. This is just my personal experience and I would like to save you the pain of coming to like it and be disappointed at what becomes of it. That saying "It is better to have loved and lost than never to have loved"? It's wrong.EDIT: Starting February the WORST POSSIBLE THING, or WPT, happend, and the aforementioned monkeys managed to lose ALL the data. That mean, level, the entire inventory, all the titles, everything, save the names, is GONE. Yes, even cash items. The best they could do was host an enormous compensation event - which is mostly over by now. Don't get me wrong, the compensation was great for those who were there. Those who were not however will now log in to find themselfs naked and broke, while everyone else has more money than they could ever farm on their own. So if you are a returner, my condolences. If you are a starter, this hardly matters to you.TL;DR:Combat's awesome, classes are fun; people are unbelievable dib♥♥♥♥♥ that more often than not can not speak english; translations are horrendously bad; endgame content was awesome, but you'll probably never know because you can't find a group as a noob and you can't not be a noob without help from others; game is buggy, "support" is insulting and slow af.A lot of content has been removed in the 90s Cap to be reworked; there is hardly anything to do now.

												One of the better F2P MMORPGs that I've played. I did clock a lot more hours previously, possibly when it was in beta, and it's certainly one of the ones I've invested most time into among its counterparts plaguing the genre.The game itself works similarly to Vindictus with instanced dungeons & loot hoarding so there is grinding involved which I'm sure is an instant nope for a lot of people. With this in mind, most quests will consist of you carrying out certain objectives around the different dungeons and while the dungeons do have difficulty settings to choose from, most of the difficulty scaling will simply come from higher level dungeons. Aside from the dungeons there is also a PVP mode which has quite a few different modes available including a ladder.The 'dynamic' combat of the game is surprisingly satisfying compared to other games that feature this style of combat and each class does have a nice variety of skills to compliment that. Each main class can specialize into two different sub-classes which you can later specialize even further which provides some nice choice for those who make alts like there's no tomorrow.The game by no means compares in visual fidelity to Vindictus but does have a nice vibrant style which suits the game well aesthetically. The overall sound is pretty commendable too ranging from satisfying sound effects to a well made sountrack that's not too overpowering. There is also a lovely Christmas song that plays in towns for those lucky to play during the Christmas event. The voice acting isn't particularly great in most cases but the lines are kept short so it should bearable even for the less tolerant.Keeping in mind that the game does involve grinding I'd only be inclined to recommend to those who are fine with that. If that's the case then by all means I recommend you give the game a shot, it is free after all.A minor complaint for the Steam version specifically is that the "Exit Dungeon" key is F12 which is also Steam's screenshot key by default, while most keys can be rebinded I see no option for this one in particular so you might want to change the key on your own Steam beforehand.

												I've started playing this mmo a week ago or so. I have to say, it's a lot of fun, mainly because of the brilliant combat system. In most MMOs you queue an attack or spell, and your character will then perform the action whenever he/she feels ready (That's why I never liked playing melee classes, you just couldn't feel the right response).In DN however, your actions are a) direct and b) you have to aim manually. This makes combat incredibly dynamic! I've played my warrior to level 29 and also tested archer, templar and mage for a few hours and they all feel very good and responsive.The second big plus in this game is atmosphere / quests briefings etc. The quests texts are actually worth reading, rather short and quite often hilarious. Quite often I feel some resemblance to the early Zelda games for N64 in this respect (and the graphic is not too far off either).As for the negative points in this game: The PVE content only takes place in small instance areas, which are rather repititive after a while. And last but not least, there are tons of mistakes in both english and german translation.Still, in conclusion, I would absolutely recommend to try this game!PS. The Steam launcher doesn't seem to be working for me. I reckon this will be fixed soon. Alternatively, you could use the old non-steam launcher (visit the website).

												I've played this game for a bit now, soloed all the way up to lv.46 (including casual soloing of abyss-mode and stuff), and these are my findings and opinions of the game so far:pro's:- combat feels pretty nice, it has a few drawbacks but the style of attacks and such fits pretty well with the overall style of the game- When you killed enemies, they have a pretty decent chance to drop food items (+hp / +mp / +hp&mp / +attack / +evade / etc). This allows you to replenish your lost health and mana for free, but do note: it's not guaranteed: there are times when they just don't really drop food.- you can get pretty much everything (apart from certain costume items and such) by just playing the game. You can speed things up with cash purchases if you wish to.- it has a mentor - pupil system (or w/e it's called, haven't used it yet myself) so you can help out friends who started the game later, or get somebody to boost you up some levels.- The devs weren't 100% serious with the entire game. You have random stuff all over the place, ranging from a dance challenge from a minotaur to guards counting down the exact amount of seconds they still have to serve. As you can probably guess, this gives a good giggle now and then. (Or the casual 'Watch out for traps', before you get rammed in the face with a massive battering ram.)- party play is encouraged- playing with friends is also encouraged (you get more xp if a person on your friends list is in your party)- private dungeons: no killstealing from random strangers- you can farm / fish / cook and make your own food. These meals generally restore a pretty good amount of HP / MP, and they aren't crippled by a lengthy cooldown. Early food in quite often in the trading house, and it's not uncommon for it to be cheaper (a piece) than the normal potions. As soon as your normal potions begin to be useless in a heated fight, start getting these food items. Do note: they have a level limit (21-30, for example), so don't stock up on hundreds of them.- no forced combo system: you can use your skills in whatever order you see fit, and figure out for yourself which order works best to annihilate your opponents.cons: - technically the game is free, but there are a lot of limitations all over the place, some obvious, some less so. A few of those things; the trading house (auction house) has a limit of the things you can put up (30/week, 5 at the same time), and they only last 12h. A 'TH coupon' mostly relieves this, with unlimited /week, 10 at the same time and up to 24h offer duration. Another thing is the bag and bank system. You get some extra slots with the level-up reward boxes you get at some levels (24 and 32 if I recall correctly), but besides those you can only expand your inventory or bank with real cash.- Early on you won't really notice it, but at mid/ later levels you get crippled by a feature called 'blessing points'. You get a set amount for daily use, and a 'backup' bar which only resets every week. From what I've heard there are some places which require BP to even enter, but overall you can still play without BP. It's just that the XP gain and loot drops are severely crippled.In a nutshell: it's a grind crippeler. (not 100% sure, but the mentor in a mentor-pupil party doesn't need BP to run an instance, the pupil does). There are a few items which can restore some BPs, but those have a limited use / day (if I recall correctly you can only use 2 pots / day).- The jumping is garbage. Really. It's pretty much a fully vertical jump, with barely any horizontal movement. The animation is as if you first stop moving, and then jump upwards. After you land you start moving again.- There is no 'casual semi-rubbish mount' for direct purchase at lv40 or something. You can only farm for some rare drops in a dungeon, or buy the tickets / cards for a lot of gold in the trading house. Or you could skip all that and purchase one with cash.- The mounts are globally a bit useless. You can only use them in towns and the areas between the towns (not the actual mission areas). And you know what's the best part of all? In the towns you can warp around (even to specific NPC's) by talking to the guards. Way faster than a mount. So effectively mounts are more eye-candy than a truly required / practical thing to have.- The normal potions are generally really underwhelming for 2 reasons:1: they restore a relatively meager amount (you generally have way more hp / mp han they restore)2: the have a 20s cooldown.The cash store potions, however, are not the same. (From what I've seen) they have a fixed rate of +30% hp or mp, and only a CD of 3s or something. You get a few of these with the level-up reward boxes.- Character creation is rather bland. You can choose between a number of classes, then you can pick between a few hair styles / faces / eye colours / skin tones / clothing items. Oh, and you can give a custom name to your character, they are nice enough to allow for that.- The graphics aren't exactly fully optimized and realistic: it's a tad 'anime' in certain aspects, and it's not exactly refined in certain ways. The 'anime' style is not directly a con, but it might turn some people away.The list of cons does appear to be larger than the pro's, but I highly advise to just give Dragon nest a try (if you don't hate lolis and anime-goons with massive swords so much you'd toss your monitor through the window).Despite it's drawbacks and annoyances, it's still an amusing game to play (in my opinion, at least).Personally I love the Chaser-class Assassin (my main). He allows me to solo quite a lot. But I might be slightly biased since it's the only character I actually leveled, next to my lv6 archer.

And in the end of each dungeon there is a boss waiting for ya...Oh my god boss battles! Is't been a while since I was excited about that! Yeah, it may sound like a simple thing, but when you have amazing fast paced arcade fighting gameplay - this simple fight can turn out to be very exciting! Especially on maximum difficulty! 												From what I can see so far, this is a very fun, enjoyable and surprisingly immersive game. It has a refreshingly new combat "style" compared to the press-a-button-and-wait combat of the average MMORPG.Good points:1. 6 classes all with varied stats and abilities, and at level 15 you can choose a specific path to go down, normally DPS and tanky.2. Brilliant combat! I cannot say how gratified I was when I discovered that you actually have to try when it comes to killing various things. Most games you just tab a nearby enemy, button mash for a while, and soon enough a dismembered creature will fall to you. With this game, you have to aim at said creature. Dodging attacks is a fun element, rolling away from an enemy's attack. And bosses do significant damage with a chance of killing you if you let your guard down. All mobs have their own special attacks too, which makes combat interesting.3. PvP is very fun, with 2 teams of 3 players lobbing fireballs at slicing away at each other. Strategy is a much beneficial aspect in this game, if you charge in staright away, you will be taken out in three seconds flat. Placing traps around the arena is advised to slow and damage enemies. 4. BALANCED CASH SHOP!!!!! The first game I have literally ever played where you don't need to spend a million quid to keep on-par with other players. The only thing you should possibly buy to help with the game at a later point is extra inventory space.5. Noticable strength increase. In most games, you need to have full sets of items and have them upgraded to the max to see any slight noticable increase in damage dealt and recieved. In Dragon Nest, upgrading one item a few times will help a lot, and make a nicely noticable difference. Sets are a great thing to have on this game however as you get useful set bonuses as a "reward" of having several items of the same tier. 6. The sounds in this game are surprisingly good, and so are the animations for your characters skills. These help make the game immersive and keep you playing for longer.Not so good points1. Gender-locked classes is a small but rather irritating thing in this game. Want a female warrior? Sorry. A male Kali? Not for you. Hopefully this will be changed in a future update.2. A little character GUI would be nice in the inventory space so you can see what your character looks like as you change equipment. However, this is probably just me being fussy.Verdict - A great F2P game that you should definately download if you are a long-time fan of MMORPGs or are new to the genre. Massive tick from me :)

												So I just randomly picked this up while bored not long ago, thinking I might get an hour or so entertainment out of it... seeing as I rarely manage to stay on an MMO for long before losing interest. Buuuuut Dragon Nest has really hit home with me, and have found it incredibly fun to play so far!As the game description says, it uses a more action-orientated combat system that makes it a heck of a lot more different from the usual ability-stacking and micromanaging you get with most MMOs, and makes combat incredibly fun and hardly like a grind at all. I've found myself picking up low-level quests on purpose, just to get them out of the way... whereas usually my quest hubs are littered with forgotten quests that I could never find the drive to clear away. It doesn't take much effort at all to look like a complete badass once you start smashing up enemies! (Note: At this point, I've only experienced the game through a cleric, after just reaching double figures in level)Graphically, the game does take some time to get used to... if you're not used to the cartoony/anime graphics of some other MMOs. And even though the graphics are hardly groundbreaking, they're not an eyesore either... it can just feel incredibly odd at first with how chibi-fied characters are, while keeping mature voices. Ah... and that's one thing that's good to mention beforehand. The voice acting is very lacking in most cases! ...But even then, I'd hardly say it's that much of a game-ruiner. Considering most dialogue is quite short.So, all in all... I was very happy to have picked up this little gem. And although it has it's flaws such as it's voice acting very minimal character creator... personally, I find the good to outweigh the bad. Combat is brilliant, the world is really quite appealing once you get into it, a fairly decent story, and it has an absolutely amazing sense of humour at times. So if you're looking for an MMO that goes away from the standard formula of WoW or similar games, at least give it a try... it's not even a big filesize! ...Just for gods sake, be careful around the blacksmiths. >_>

												So before I say anything else -- I see so many people having trouble with this game, please allow me to share some simple solutions!> 1.) The Cherry Account asks for too much information.Just fill in whatever. They don't check your information, I literally got through saying that I am a non existent person living in the state of I made this up.> 2.) It won't let me enter my pin.It didn't let me either -- not through the game launcher, at least. I went to the website, logged in there, and succesfully created a pin within seconds. Worked smoothly in-game after that.> 3.) Steam launcher won't work.It does that sometimes. You can either a) restart the launcher until it DOES work, or b) go to C:\program files(x86)\steam\steamapps\common\DragonNestEurope and find the folder that says DragonNest. From there, start the launcher manually. (To make this easier to access, you can just drag the folder to your desktop, too.).. And that should solve all the problems! These solutions will take a few minutes at most, and you get a great game in return for it.And now, the actual review! (NOTE that I have done the map dragging thing, too, hence Steam stopped counting my hours in the game. I have maaaany more hours in this than the 28,4 recorded!)The Pros Combat is fun! It's no simple "click on the enemy and they will die". You actually have to DO things in this game, haha. Once you're familiar with all the attacks you have, a level up happens and a new ability or skill becomes available. Keeps it nice and fresh! Dungeons are (almost) all different! There's a bunch of different environments and while one or two may occasionally be alike, no two of them really look the same. Keeps you exploring, too! The story changes with each class you play as. Play the game as a warrior, your story is different next time you replay it as an assassin. Again, keeps it nice and fresh. PvP apparently is lots of fun! I haven't tried it myself yet, but I've seen videos, heard stories.. all very nice and positive. It seems very promising! The community is REALLY friendly, for as far as I can tell. People are helpful, kind, and willing to help you level. Bonus points! Leveling goes at a nice and balanced pace. Not so quickly that it makes the whole level system seem irrelevant, but fast enough to make you feel like you're really progressing. You'll feel productive after a few hours of dungeoning, rather than tired after a few days of grinding (which is the case in many other MMORPGs). I am a cleric. I can dance. I feel like a one man boyband. ..I am a dancing boyband cleric. Truthfully, that's all I ever needed in life.The Cons Limited character customisation. Classes are gender locked, and you can only choose from a few hairstyles, colors, facial features and outfit colors.  The start may feel a little lonely. Probably because everyone's been having so many trouble registering, the starting areas (for me at least!) were very quiet. It wasn't until I reached the third town that I saw another player for the first time. Once you get there, though, there's a nice amount of other players! Some things are outdated. A friend of mine and me have been looking for something called "the Apocalypse Nest" for FOREVER.. only to later hear from another player that it has long been removed from the game. The dungeons are.. or have gotten.. way too easy. Like waaay too easy. Apparently, things get really difficult from level 80 and on (and SUPER difficult near the level cap?), but I'm currently level 57 and have yet to get my HP below 75% for the first time. In fact, I'm now dungeoning without armor in hopes of creating somewhat of a challenge, haha. The graphics aren't all that great. They're still okay, though! ..cash items are expensive.. eehhh-- THE VOICE ACTING NOWould I recommend this game?Aha, well, yes! Once you're past the whole starting process, the game really is great fun. Pros weighed against cons, I'd say the game is easily enjoyable enough to make up for its weaknesses. The only thing I really do hope they update is the difficulty level.. Who knows, though. Maybe once I'm level 80, I'll wish I could return to the times things were still this easy. Haha. Welp, one way to find out..

												This game is pretty damn good, if I do say so myself. It does have elements of originallity while keep in style with the classic MMORPG.Gameplay:This is the unique part, I don't know if it's my lack of scowering the internet and downloading shady Anime MMORPGs but, I will say the play style is amazing. The roam, the combat, it all  completely immerses you in the game. The quests aren't too repetitive, however you do find yourself going to the same dungeon at least once or twice, but that isn't much of a problem since each dungeon is enjoyable to complete with the intense, fast action combat. Controls:The idea of having a mouse sensitivity option avaliable at the press of two keys is extremely helpful, due to all the combat being manual, some may have a hard time aiming, however it is easy to get used to. The controls are neatly laid out and easily customizable for those with different preferred layout. As for the controller support, I manage to try it out for a short period of time and personally I can only say the keyboard controls were easier for me to use, if you're more comfortable with a controller and start out with a controller, then it would probably be easier.Character Customization:Despite how amazing this game is overall, I'd have to say, the customization is lacking, A LOT. And I mean, A LOT. That is one thing they could improve one with more hairstyles and colours avaliable, because I generally see a lot of clones walking around low-leveled areas. I myself think it would add to the immersive gameplay to have more options, as people would be able to customize characters where you don't see same-faces walking around, making you as a character feel unique compared to everyone else.Connection:It's great they decided to spread Dragon Nest to Europe, I can't image how much that helped people in Europe with not-so stable internet connection. While I experience no issue with connection, other than tiny almost unnoticable lag spikes in crowded areas (my game pretty much runs as smooth as silk), my friend (this might be due to their bad computer and internet connection) has issues, more often than not, during loading times their game tends to freezes, and every now and then the game will suddenly crash, which is troublesome if in a dungeon that is close to being completed. It would be nice to get more servers in, especially if they were to cater to different parts of Europe (e.g. North West, South East etc.) And that may help connection issues even further.Play Time:I will say, the play time is immense. But what do you expect from an MMORPG, 4-10 hours gameplay? You're kidding right? So far I've played 52 hours, and I have a level 25 (soon 26) Warrior, a level 16 (going on 17) Cleric, a level 6 Academic and a Level 10 Cleric, along with a few level 1s I've been neglecting. In the early stages of the game, level is pretty quick if you dungeon almost non-stop (like myself) and you find you can get to level 15+ in the space of 2-4 hours. However once you reach the level 17+ mark, leveling and experience gain drops dramatically. Some (myself not includded) would think of this as tedious, the sudden difficulty in level could prove frustrating, however despite it's suddeness, to me, it ensures we don't get Maxed out Level 60s right off the bat who actually have no idea how half of the mechanics work in the game. It creates a balance, slowing down those deemed as "inexperienced" and allowing them to go at a slower pace, learning each and every mechanic along the way. So when they do get to Level 60, they aren't completely lost on how to do anything.TL;DRThis game is incredibly fun if you excuse the lack of customization or it doesn't really matter to you. The controls are crisp and easy to grasp and change if necessary, however for long-time keyboard gamers, the controller support is not recommended. And you find you can easily get attatched to the game, with many hours of play time. However, I wouldn't recommend this a game (unless you really want to play it) if you have poor internet or a computer that is rather slow due to the overal size of the game being huge.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2015
												7/10Cons:The game itself is a fun game to waste hours on but the one thing that sets the game back is how there's quite a few game breaking bugs. For example your character can't complete or even start the main quest which sucks if you've put quite a lot of hours getting your character leveled up, this isn't really an issue if you're level 15 or lower as it doesn't take much time to get back to those levels but once you reach a higher level such as 30 or above and sunk around 10 hours into the game, it's a real chore to get back the progress you've lost.The quest markers may often direct you to an entirely different area then where you need to go (this becomes more frequent once you reach Saint Haven) so you spend 10 minutes running around looking stupid wondering why the Dark Mines aren't in the area you're at or even you cleared a dungeon out for no reason only to figure out that where you were wasn't the correct area.But there's only one thing worse than the bugs mentioned and it's the God Awful voice acting in the game, most of the NPCs you talk to sound like they woke up from a 3 hour sleep and are still half asleep, but since the game is free you shouldn't really expect amazing-ness as far as voice acting goes.There is a lack of a main menu which if you just boot up the game for the first time you'll have to suffer through loud music until you finish creating your character (same goes with other options, just using sound as an example)If you're playing this game during the Christmas event then the jingle bells instrumental loop will drive you insane so it'll make you want to pick up the quest as fast as possible and bolt out of there.Pros:The game provides quite a lot of characters to choose from so you can always replay the game as a different character to find out which best fits out your playstyle. The characters also have different paths they can take ability wise so you can pick a different path to make your playstyle more combat or team player focused. The characters are all unique in their own way, classes like the Cleric are more suited for team play and classes like the warrior are more suited for combat which makes it easy for a party to figure out a tactic before heading into a dungeon.With 80 levels to achieve you'll really sink in a lot of hours playing this game, getting to that final level after putting hours into the game will give you a sense of accomplishment when you do so in the end. The combat system is surprisingly fluid for a free to play game, it's a real time RPG where you have to constantly be on your feet to no get wombo combo'd into the next dimension and allows new players to easily get a feel for the combo mechanics of the game so that they can almost effortlessly take care of anything that stands in your way. The controls are simple yet effective when it comes to the battlefield.Not feeling PvE? Well there's always PVP (I'm not very good at this). You can pit up against a friend or a stranger in the coliseum to finally prove who is the ultimate warrior. The PVP offers a unique system which balances out the gear and damage of the players to make sure that even a level 20 can still have a chance of duking it out with a level 80 in the arena and coming out victorious or not get one shot by them (of course this can be changed in the lobby settings but most people prefer to have balance on).There are also fun challenges you can complete in the circus like a boss rush for example, where you pit out against all of the bosses in a certain area, sometimes with modifiers so you might fight an invisible manticore from time to time. Or even an EXP arena where you have to kill a predetermined amount of enemies before fighting the boss, giving you quite the amount of loot I'm the end.With a ton of side quests there will never be something you can't do in the game. But if you do have all of the quests completed you can always flirt with pretty much any NPC in the game so it's not only an RPG but a dating simulator. (if you're in a place where the legal age of consent is 18 or above we do not suggest doing this as the game would be pedophile simulator but if it's around 17 to about 15 then it's legal :^) ) You can also be a total pervert and look up their skirts which is probably the best way to spend your time in the game.You can beat the living♥♥♥♥♥♥out of santa until he drops you presents (I do not recommend you to do this as it'll put you on the naughty list for life)You can get a homeless man to give you money as an event and then flirt with him by giving him badges.

												FROM A 2 HOUR PLAY EXPERIENCE At first i was sceptical from the screenshots, id assume that the game would be mostly about dressing up a character to look pervy as possible and have extremely weak gameplay but i was quite wrong. this game is a action rpg and is very true to that. its about hitting alot of targets at once while on the move, doging attacks and racking up a high combo while clearing a dungeon with a good score and a fast time, very arcady but in a good way. i have only played the warrior class to get a grip of a beginner in the game and i will say that the actions and skills look great. every move and attack you do gave me a impact that i was doing heavy damage. and having different skills that you can unlock and level up quests in this game are not a chore either ( from starting point) alot of the quests either involve talking to other npc's about retreiving items or following the main plot. this is fine as most fetch quests involve completing a dungeon and you dont need to specificly search for the item, just beat the crap out of the monsters and clear the dungeon to get your quest item.another good note is that the difficulty is set out very well, specificly telling you how hard a level is going to be, the exp you will earn and how large your party will need to be to get the most out of that difficulty. HERE IS A RUN DOWN....Good...Action/Skills make you feel powerful and look great though the animationsarcady action feelsimple quests/ easy to acheive if done properlydifferent difficulties give choice to go small or risk big for Expeasy to party up.Bad....Graphical quality ( i know the requirements are low but even on a high setting its not very impressive, kinda like WoW on low)limited character creation from startlag is introduced when in a hub with alot of players at oncenot really a MMORPG in my OPINION (more like a Action co-op RPG. due to the dungeon setup and and small party count in a dungeon at once)i would say more but i have not played enough to give a enitre opinion.

												For players, who are bored of playing other anime-style MMORPGs, such as S4, Fiesta Online, etc., I can recommend this game. There are 16 final classes, with different weapons, skills, roles, etc. This game has much better graphics than the other anime-style MMORPGs, looks so amazing for an anime-style MMO. The creators of this game didn't think about making low level abilities less spectacular, and making high level abilities more spectacular, all of the abilities are spectacular I think. Of course, there are big differences between low and high level skill in which is more spectacular, or less, but the low level skills are spectaculars too I think, unlike in most of the MMORPGs, where your low level skill is only a slash, or if you're an archer you shot 2 arrows instead of 1 (seriously?:D). A different between other MMOs and DN is there aren't incredibly huge armors, but there are big weapons, which feel like "real ones". *Spoiler*: (e.g.: if you are using a two-handed hammer, your attack moves are slower and look like you are nearly not able to hold your weapon, because that's too hard for you. It gives the game a special feeling I guess.) *End of spoiler* Crafting is easy I think, and the bosses...Bosses are incredibly and amazingly huge. It's an anime-style MMO, so bosses are so huge as I said before, and if they hit you, you'll better begin to think about healing yourself, or asking of helping. The game has story too. Nothing special, but It does have. Bugs: I didn't notice any bugs If I remember well, there's maintance only sometimes, and the game never crashes.  You can see I don't have any hours of gameplay on Steam because I had started to play this game before It was released on Steam, so don't worry, I gained experiences about this game :D I can only recommend this for players who want to try out and play an anime-style, fast-style MMORPG. 												Dragon Nest is a very simple and rather silly "MMO" with surprisingly fun combat.It's obvious they're working on a very tight budget, but that doesn't stop the game from being enjoyable. Though I've only played a bit so far so I don't know what it's like in the long run, my first impression is very positive.Here's the main points I'd focus on so far:-There's very little voice acting, and what there is isn't great. They've also left in some combat shouts that I assume is Korean.-The translation is rather poor in places and the quests are very basic.-The graphics are rather simple, but they're colorful and cartoony.-I put the quotes around MMO because the combat areas are instanced, and can only be shared with party members.-The combat areas are also (so far at least) very short and linear.-At the end of each instanced 'dungeon' you fight a mini-boss after which you get graded on how well you did, for example I've gotten A rank on the first few I've done.-Combat itself is responsive and the skills are fun to use. There is no forced locking on to enemies, you just do attacks and the enemies that are in range of the attack get hit.-There is very limited character creation. You can only choose class and then a few different hair/face styles. For example the Kali which I tried first is female only.If you're looking for an in depth MMO, this isn't for you. 												I was a CBTester for this back in SEA.I immediately fell in love with this game because of the combat system, its one of the most fun i have ever seen in an MMO.I played this game in SEA for about 2 or 3 years before i ended up quitting, mostly because of the Pay-to-Win, now i have to say the EU version did not have the same sort of P2W as SEA did, but now they offically sold themselves to CherryCredits (The publisher for SEA).The game itself is only fun because of the combat system, i cannot say this enough.Developers of this game keep insisting on making it worse over the years, they have removed more content than adding new. The endgame is basically non existant as of now, in the current patch they removed literally all of the "Nests" (Raids) in order to "improve" them and there is no ETA on when they are going to be returning. I must add that the endgame of this game was absolute garbage to begin with and removing the small amount what there was is completely idiotic.The end game (how it was at least before it was removed) consisted on running Raids with a weekly clear limit to farm up equipment pieces and crafting materials, it is utterly mind numbing and tedious to run the same stuff every week until you hit the cap, and as of now there is only 1 end game raid, since they removed the rest.The PvP was also one of the bigger things in the game, since obviously there is nothing else to do, but the PvP side in EU at least has been dead as far as i know pretty much from the beginning, in SEA it was more prominent.But now since the SEA version and the EU version are practically ran by the same company, it might get better, but im afraid it can only get worse since now the P2W aspect will come to play more strongly.TLDR:The combat system is fun, but that is all that there is.No endgame, Nothing to do, Farming is pointless since there is nothing to farm for unless you run Nests which have a small weekly limit.I might go back to visit this game in the future, but i will definetly not be staying around for long.Im not saying the game is a complete waste, its pretty good if you want to waste some time, but thats all it is.

												If you like MMORPG's this a relaxing game for you. It's different than others, with a little 'childish' aspect in it. This aspect makes the game more fun. Pick one of the classes and start leveling it, maximum level is 70. You can create more than 1 character too! It's not only fun to level more character, but also effective! By combining the levels from different kind of characters, you can unlock skills you can't with just 1 character. This motivates you to continue leveling.The graphics are ok, but it's not a game you should play because of the graphics. The gameplay is balanced and the combat is great. A lot of action, hack-and-slash mostly.A lot of quests can be found anywhere, no matter where you look, you'll find some. The quests mostly ask you to go in an 'instance', but these are possible to solo.Playing this game with a friend or more than 1 friend makes it even more fun. Compare each others skills and damage within the dungeons, explore new spells and share your thoughts about the class you're playing.Every day there are random events that can be found at the 'events planner', which can be found in any city.This game is relaxing and fun to play. This game is Free-to-Play, but there is a 'real-money'-shop available for the 'hardcore'-players. With the real money, you can buy costumes, gems, etc. etc.It's totally different from other MMORPG's, but it's comparable with 'Eden Eternal' or any of this kind. Not hard, easy to understand and fast to play.Pros- Fast-paced combat- 'Childish' aspect- Lots of quests- Events to do besides your daily questing.Cons- Melee classes are Male-only- Ranged classes are Female-only- Lot of high-levels begging for 'Likes'Rating7.5/10The game is awesome, relaxing and fast-paced.Recommended?Yes, I recommend it. It's a Free-to-Play game, so you won't need any money. It has a lot of gameplay, which lets you get to a maximum of level 70. Combining characters-levels will unlock even more skills. Playing the game with friends is a good idea. Playing it for days/weeks/months is possible.

												 I played this game for years before finally quit, mainly because I reached a stage in my life that required me to focus on other things beside this game, and I just didn't had the time to play any more. From what I can see, the registration system chagned, and it sucks. The good thing is that you can just put whatever information you want and you're good to go. I don't see this as a reason not to play the game. The things that I hate about the game tho are pretty simple - right now is hard for me to actually enter the game, create a character and start playing, because the process is laggy and full of bugs. A lot of times when I try to create a character or log in the "Disconnected from server" error keeps apearing and it gets me out of the game. Also, a thing I noticed, whenever you try to create a character, you create it, then you kind of have to quit the game and enter again to be able to actually see the character you created. This is pretty horrible if you want to create multiple characters and play with a lot of them. Those are the two main problems I see with this game - the hard registration process and the bugs the game has from time to time. Beside that, I did not play enough of it to see how it works with all the new updates. I did not play the game for a while, but the way I remember it, was pretty good.  The only thing I do not like is that at high levels things get a little too hard, especially if you want to play alone, and not have a cleric or tank with you. If you're a mage at high levels, well good luck with that.  Beside those problems, the game is great. Awesome combat system, decent graphics, skills that look like skills, not like little lights comming out of your weapons, and interesting dungeoons.  My opinion - a good game, beside the bugs and hard progress at high levels. Play this game to have fun and don't take it too seriously - it will get horrible at level 50-60.

												One of the better F2P MMORPGs that I've played. I did clock a lot more hours previously, possibly when it was in beta, and it's certainly one of the ones I've invested most time into among its counterparts plaguing the genre.The game itself works similarly to Vindictus with instanced dungeons & loot hoarding so there is grinding involved which I'm sure is an instant nope for a lot of people. With this in mind, most quests will consist of you carrying out certain objectives around the different dungeons and while the dungeons do have difficulty settings to choose from, most of the difficulty scaling will simply come from higher level dungeons. Aside from the dungeons there is also a PVP mode which has quite a few different modes available including a ladder.The 'dynamic' combat of the game is surprisingly satisfying compared to other games that feature this style of combat and each class does have a nice variety of skills to compliment that. Each main class can specialize into two different sub-classes which you can later specialize even further which provides some nice choice for those who make alts like there's no tomorrow.The game by no means compares in visual fidelity to Vindictus but does have a nice vibrant style which suits the game well aesthetically. The overall sound is pretty commendable too ranging from satisfying sound effects to a well made sountrack that's not too overpowering. There is also a lovely Christmas song that plays in towns for those lucky to play during the Christmas event. The voice acting isn't particularly great in most cases but the lines are kept short so it should bearable even for the less tolerant.Keeping in mind that the game does involve grinding I'd only be inclined to recommend to those who are fine with that. If that's the case then by all means I recommend you give the game a shot, it is free after all.A minor complaint for the Steam version specifically is that the "Exit Dungeon" key is F12 which is also Steam's screenshot key by default, while most keys can be rebinded I see no option for this one in particular so you might want to change the key on your own Steam beforehand.

												So after giving this game 88.7 hrs (according to right now) I have this to say:I love this game. The combat is amazing and the dungeons are great. However, this game could've been so much better than it is currently (even though I will keep playing it).CONS: The quests are not engaging at all. No matter the quest, if it's in a dungeon you'll clear it pretty much automatically just by finishing the dungeon. Also, if you like to complete ALL quests, you'll be sent to the same dungeons about a thousand times over. Main quest especially. I had 8 possible dungeons I could visit at one point. It first sent me to the first dungeon, then the second, then the first, then the second, then the second again, then the first, then the third and then all those three. It gets repetitive really fast. The translation in this game is horrible. I gave up pretty fast reading anything (and it's a lot of text), since it doesn't make any sense because of grammatical and linguistic errors. There's a lot of other errors with the text as well, such as more than 50% of quests I've done points to the wrong dungeon (in the text, they are correct in the quest log) Voice acting is lacking in more ways than one. Many characters aren't voiced and many cut scenes aren't voiced. Others are, and that's where the weird stuff happens. Some keeps their original asian voices while some has new english speaking voices. Overall, I think the game should make up it's mind if it wanted to keep the original voices or add new ones, it just feels half-done. This game can be played without paying a dime, but you gain so much from spending some money on it. Because of that it's pretty much P2W. You can basically only get "costumes" (stuff that looks better than the gear you have) by spending money. This would've been fine, if it wasn't for the fact that these costumes have stats! Pretty high stats too! This is also a problem since I want to use costumes I think looks nice, but I'm pretty much forced into using costumes with better stats instead. If you have a problem with female skimpy dresses, this game is probably not for you. My archer has such short skirt you can basically see her whole butt at all times. I don't really mind though, but I know many do.So these cons above could seem to be a deal breaker. So why am I recommending  this game? Because of all the pros:PROS: Amazing combat system. I've been playing as an archer and I'm in love with everything. This is the main point of the game it's done incredibly well. You can definatly feel your skill level go up when you play this game. Playing makes you better and gear truly makes a difference. Lot's of customization options for your characters looks and playstyle. It's great and it really feels like I can play the game just as I want to. Quite generous events. You'll get a lot of stuff doing them and it's pretty much only worth buying anything during an event since you can sometimes more than double your moneys worth. Seems to have a somewhat kind and good community. Everyone I've talked to have been quite nice. Very good oppurtunities for the single lone wolf player (such as me). Pretty much everything but the late game is doable solo even at the hardest difficulties. As a archer anyway, haven't played the other classes.  You can get rich by playing the auction-house game if that's what you are interested in. You'll probably need a special P2Get auction house ticket to do it though.These pros make a very enjoyable game. It does have a lot of shortcomings though which I hope (but doubt) will be fixed in the future. I'm enjoying it, so I'll give it a thumbs up. You'll have to test it out for yourself though to see if the cons are too much for you.

												This game is fun, really fun.There are 7 playable classes, (Warrior, Archer, Assassin, Cleric, Tinkerer, Kali and Sorceress), each one leading to 2 subclasses that lead to another 2 subsubclasses. Each class is unique and powerful in its own way, it's fun to play as every single character, by default you can't have up to 12 characters so you have a lot of options.The anime like visuals may not be up to date but suit the game very well and the animations look gorgeous and detailed, frame-by-frame. The textures aren't very good, they look like ```` most of the times.The abilities are the best part, every time you use one it feels like you are actually the one doing the ability, the sound and animations do their job very well.This isn't a open world kill monsters MMO, instead the monsters are in dungeons. The dungeons have a number of levels, and in last level there is a boss (duh), after beating the boss you get a reward depending on the difficulty chosen and a grade showing how much you suck.The Nests are like, mega dungeons, where it's best to have a party with you and you get really good rewards at the end of the Nest. You can only do one Nest a certain number of times per week, I don't like that.The story is skipable, I personally don't read it, the voice acting is garbage, but the funny kind of garbage.The PvP is amazing, it really is, if you fight someone your level you will see what I mean, I do not recommend fighting someone that is 5 or more levels above you, it may be frustrating, and only go PvP at level 15. The bad thing about PvP is that they change the stats, cooldowns and cost of abilities from PvE, wich isn't a bad thing, but it's kind of bleh, you strongest ability that does 10.000 damage only does 3.000 damage now. But it's balance stuff, so don't worry. The updates are slow, and for them to compensate that, they make Events, they may add new mini-levels, temporary raids or seasonal stuff. Besides that they just add costumes that you need to buy with money (update.png). I really hope they add new updates soon, this has a level 70 cap, but other servers, like the korean ones, have a level 80 cap and a new class. We will need to wait a while for that to reach Europe ;_;.  Just to finish it off, those people saying ''Dis p2w u can't pley dis >lel'' are very wrong. You can play this without wasting a single cent, you just need to work hard to get to that point, and also have some luck :3. You can get money items/costumes from the trading house that people sell, and also from events.  The last very important thing is that you shouldn't quit the game before reaching level 24. At level 24 is where you get the good stuff, your first official set and it is also the point where you should be moving to the next city, where you will see if you really want to quit or not, because of the new dungeons, nests and npcs. If you are still doubting the game and you made it to level 24, just play untill you can do the 2nd nest, then your decision should be final. But to those idiots saying ''Well I reached level 13 and this game is garbage...'' '' Oh! I reached level 20 and this sux!!1'', let me say that you are a ♥♥♥♥ing idiot. I recommend playing with friends, or getting a guild, the community here is very friendly and you may find many friends here, like I did.This review does say a lot of good things, but the game has its flaws, some may even quit because of the art style, or even the voice acting. Note this, the game isn't perfect, I said what I really loved about it and what people should be looking to get.

												Totally recommend it, the gameplay and the story are sick...The game is pretty much easy at the beginning and gets harder as you level up and unlock new features. Up to level 50 it should be pretty much easy if u gear yourself to decent (epic set +6) cost around 10-20 gold(set materials in trading house) if you buy it or you can do the nests for the sets :) there are quite a lot of helpfull players on the server which will carry you in nests ^^.After level 50 the gameplay pretty much gets harder. Also team work is essential. You can't really do one high level nest alone, well you can but u have to be really good geared and know all the mechanics and evade pretty much all of them but that will also take a lot of time.There are lots of fun peoples in-game and most of them are social and helpful, so you can make a lots of friends in game and be able to get a party for nests easily. 												This game is amazing; they don't lie to you when they say fast-paced action! In this game you have so much to do, and so much to explore! This game is overwhelmingly good for RPG-type gamers and gamers that want to waste some time. Leveling in this is very, but VERY slow, but that's what makes it a extremely long playthrough. And I MEAN long. Every now and then you have to buy new equipment because even though your skill does matter, you'll always need better gear. This game has alot of replayability and a character personalizarion that's almost as big as TF2's cosmetic system.The part that really got me nuts was when I had to get better gear from nests. If you don't know what a nest is, you'll know in your playthrough. The first nest (Minotaur) is actually quite easy for most people, but every other nest is very hard when you have the priveous nest's gear. Tecnically, this isn't really a bad thing, it makes the game not so easy but challenging wich makes it even better. I don't play this game for competion purposes, but you might. If you want, simply max out your character in every way possible and then go battle other players. The guild system in this game is quite good, the dialog is--- okay let's be honest here, people are only going to read mostly half of the game's dialog, just to know the game's story. There are HUNDREDS of side quests you can do to get better gear and money, wich make the game have even more replayability. Also there are dozens of ways to make your character.The things I was most annoyed at is that you can't trade mounts, almost every pair of wings, pets or anything that's in the "AC" tab of your inventory, and that you have to buy a scroll to reset your skillz. Like, if you create a character, but then you become tired of it and go and create another character, you can only give that character your gear and your money, but you can't give pets! I know that there's a gift option in the store but what if I already have a pet? I can't give it to my other character.But anything other than that, it's still a very, Very, VERY good game and I'm sure you too will have a great time playing this game. Just don't make the nest that is near your level meta, and you'll be fine.

Up to level 50 it should be pretty much easy if u gear yourself to decent (epic set +6) cost around 10-20 gold(set materials in trading house) if you buy it or you can do the nests for the sets :) there are quite a lot of helpfull players on the server which will carry you in nests ^^.After level 50 the gameplay pretty much gets harder. Lots of events, updates and new stuff added monthly...Nests are based on mechanics not only hack and slash and stuff like that, so if you want to do a high level nest you need to learn the bosses (attack patterns, mechanics which activate on a set timing or when the boss hp bar decreases)  to be able to dodge. You can't really do one high level nest alone, well you can but u have to be really good geared and know all the mechanics and evade pretty much all of them but that will also take a lot of time.There are lots of fun peoples in-game and most of them are social and helpful, so you can make a lots of friends in game and be able to get a party for nests easily. 												This game is fun, really fun.There are 7 playable classes, (Warrior, Archer, Assassin, Cleric, Tinkerer, Kali and Sorceress), each one leading to 2 subclasses that lead to another 2 subsubclasses. Each class is unique and powerful in its own way, it's fun to play as every single character, by default you can't have up to 12 characters so you have a lot of options.The anime like visuals may not be up to date but suit the game very well and the animations look gorgeous and detailed, frame-by-frame. The textures aren't very good, they look like ```` most of the times.The abilities are the best part, every time you use one it feels like you are actually the one doing the ability, the sound and animations do their job very well.This isn't a open world kill monsters MMO, instead the monsters are in dungeons. The dungeons have a number of levels, and in last level there is a boss (duh), after beating the boss you get a reward depending on the difficulty chosen and a grade showing how much you suck.The Nests are like, mega dungeons, where it's best to have a party with you and you get really good rewards at the end of the Nest. You can only do one Nest a certain number of times per week, I don't like that.The story is skipable, I personally don't read it, the voice acting is garbage, but the funny kind of garbage.The PvP is amazing, it really is, if you fight someone your level you will see what I mean, I do not recommend fighting someone that is 5 or more levels above you, it may be frustrating, and only go PvP at level 15. The bad thing about PvP is that they change the stats, cooldowns and cost of abilities from PvE, wich isn't a bad thing, but it's kind of bleh, you strongest ability that does 10.000 damage only does 3.000 damage now. But it's balance stuff, so don't worry. The updates are slow, and for them to compensate that, they make Events, they may add new mini-levels, temporary raids or seasonal stuff. Besides that they just add costumes that you need to buy with money (update.png). I really hope they add new updates soon, this has a level 70 cap, but other servers, like the korean ones, have a level 80 cap and a new class. We will need to wait a while for that to reach Europe ;_;.  Just to finish it off, those people saying ''Dis p2w u can't pley dis >lel'' are very wrong. You can play this without wasting a single cent, you just need to work hard to get to that point, and also have some luck :3. You can get money items/costumes from the trading house that people sell, and also from events.  The last very important thing is that you shouldn't quit the game before reaching level 24. At level 24 is where you get the good stuff, your first official set and it is also the point where you should be moving to the next city, where you will see if you really want to quit or not, because of the new dungeons, nests and npcs. If you are still doubting the game and you made it to level 24, just play untill you can do the 2nd nest, then your decision should be final. But to those idiots saying ''Well I reached level 13 and this game is garbage...'' '' Oh! I reached level 20 and this sux!!1'', let me say that you are a ♥♥♥♥ing idiot. I recommend playing with friends, or getting a guild, the community here is very friendly and you may find many friends here, like I did.This review does say a lot of good things, but the game has its flaws, some may even quit because of the art style, or even the voice acting. Note this, the game isn't perfect, I said what I really loved about it and what people should be looking to get.

												The creating an account part is as hard as cracking the code for Japanese Captcha for a game like PSO2 if not harder....----------------------If you can get past the horrific account creation and the broken launcher this game isn't bad it is actually a lot of fun.As other people have states don't take it to seriously just sit back and enjoy it.Play it with a friend and just have a generally good time.As far as gameplay goes there is a lot of depht put into customization, Specifically gatherable equipment.You can upgrade gear to +something something as seen in many Jap~ MMO's.You can have many skills and all can be used and I myself prefer to use the controller.Combat is fluid and makes you feel awesome, It is quite breath taking once you get further into the game.The controller support is pretty good although navigating through multiple menu's is best done with the mouse....
